channel.title: Mazda rx7 Fortune
channel.description:
Would you pay 11 K for the body kit? its a beast of a car, with only
Accelaration 0-100 km/u in 5,3 s (standard) it has a 1.4 rotary engine with 247 Hp

When did I argue for or against coil springs? I never did. Therefor your argument is moot.
[/quote]

You said leaf springs are ‘medieval suspension’, which implies there is something much better, which is wrong because the way corvette’s use leaf springs is cutting edge technology and the best type of suspension you can get these days.[/quote]

Leaf springs are medieval suspension, but the way the corvette’s using them is cutting edge technology.

item.title: Mazda rx7 Fortune
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Bebe, post:35, topic:333069”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=429488.msg3180898#msg3180898 date=1271290779]

I’d rather buy a used 2005 Corvette… Is that just me?

Have fun on your leaf spring medieval suspension :rolleyes:

Since 1962 Corvettes have NEVER had leaf springs like you are thinking of, they have independent rear suspension, and it is actually a BETTER setup than coil springs in the rear. So learn something before you go spouting off nonsense, thanks.
[/quote]
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corvette_leaf_spring

tl;dr:

Since 1984 the Corvette has used a transverse fiberglass composite leaf spring as part of the suspension. The C5 and C6 both have very similar double A-arm suspensions that wouldn’t look out of place on any high end sports car. The only significant difference being instead of a coil over spring the Vette is using a single leaf spring.

Oh and what do we have here. hmmm seems to be a picture of the C5,C6 generation rear suspension:

And to further my point:

So in your own words: learn something before you go spouting off nonsense, thanks. :)[/quote]

I said leaf springs like you are thinking of:

As stated in the wikipedia article you linked to, having independent suspension supported by leaf springs in the way the corvette uses them, it is actually a BETTER setup than coil springs in the rear as other cars have. It is about as far from the above picture as you can get.

Read full topic

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corvette_leaf_spring

tl;dr:

Since 1984 the Corvette has used a transverse fiberglass composite leaf spring as part of the suspension. The C5 and C6 both have very similar double A-arm suspensions that wouldn't look out of place on any high end sports car. The only significant difference being instead of a coil over spring the Vette is using a single leaf spring.

Oh and what do we have here. hmmm seems to be a picture of the C5,C6 generation rear suspension:

And to further my point:

So in your own words: learn something before you go spouting off nonsense, thanks.

item.title: Mazda rx7 Fortune
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:32, topic:333069”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=429488.msg3182871#msg3182871 date=1271473639]

I’d rather buy a used 2005 Corvette… Is that just me?

Have fun on your leaf spring medieval suspension :rolleyes:

Since 1962 Corvettes have NEVER had leaf springs like you are thinking of, they have independent rear suspension, and it is actually a BETTER setup than coil springs in the rear. So learn something before you go spouting off nonsense, thanks.

Corvette fan eh?

Not so much, I’d rather have a Mopar.
[/quote]Isn’t a Mopar just a car built from various parts?[/quote]

All cars are built from a variety of parts I suppose. But Mopar represents Chrysler, Dodge, Plymouth, and Jeep just like GM represents GMC, Chevrolet, Buick, Pontiac, so on and so forth…

Read full topic

item.title: Mazda rx7 Fortune
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:31, topic:333069”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=429488.msg3183795#msg3183795 date=1271546773]
For the record:

[quote]Ford makes many different parts for Mazda and Mazda makes parts for Ford. There are three owner of Mazda Corporation. 1) Mazda 2) Ford Motor Company 3) Sumitomo Bank of Japan. Ford Motor Company has the controlling interest of Mazda. Ford Motor Corporation owns 33.4% of Mazda. If you think that when you purchase a General Motors or a Chrysler automobile that you are getting a 100% american automobile…Well I have bad news for you… Ford ,GM and Chrysler all own foriegn automobile companies. They share powertrain and other parts as well as technology with each of the companies that they own. I hope this helped you understand your issue with Ford Motor Company.
[/quote]
[/quote]
That’s from three years ago. Also (not saying it is or isn’t true), yahoo answers isn’t really a reputable source…[/quote]

Yeah its even worse now, which is the reason I will never buy a mazda in my life.

Read full topic

item.title: Mazda rx7 Fortune
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

For the record:

Ford makes many different parts for Mazda and Mazda makes parts for Ford. There are three owner of Mazda Corporation. 1) Mazda 2) Ford Motor Company 3) Sumitomo Bank of Japan. Ford Motor Company has the controlling interest of Mazda. Ford Motor Corporation owns 33.4% of Mazda. If you think that when you purchase a General Motors or a Chrysler automobile that you are getting a 100% american automobile...Well I have bad news for you... Ford ,GM and Chrysler all own foriegn automobile companies. They share powertrain and other parts as well as technology with each of the companies that they own. I hope this helped you understand your issue with Ford Motor Company.
